org.gridgain.grid.spi.discovery.tcp.ipfinder.vm
Class GridTcpDiscoveryVmIpFinder

java.lang.Object
  org.gridgain.grid.spi.discovery.tcp.ipfinder.GridTcpDiscoveryIpFinderAdapter
      org.gridgain.grid.spi.discovery.tcp.ipfinder.vm.GridTcpDiscoveryVmIpFinder
All Implemented Interfaces:
GridTcpDiscoveryIpFinder
public class GridTcpDiscoveryVmIpFinder
extends GridTcpDiscoveryIpFinderAdapter

IP Finder which works only with pre-configured list of IP addresses specified via GridTcpDiscoveryVmIpFinder.setAddresses(Iterable) method. By default, this IP finder is not shared, which means that all grid nodes have to be configured with the same list of IP addresses when this IP finder is used.

Configuration

Mandatory

There are no mandatory configuration parameters.

Optional

  • Addresses for initialization (see GridTcpDiscoveryVmIpFinder.setAddresses(Iterable))
  • Shared flag (see GridTcpDiscoveryIpFinderAdapter.setShared(boolean))

Method Detail

setAddresses

@GridSpiConfiguration(optional=true)
public void setAddresses(Iterable<String> addrs)
                  throws GridSpiException
Parses provided values and initializes the internal collection of addresses.

Addresses may be represented as follows:

  • IP address (i.e. 127.0.0.1, 9.9.9.9, etc);
  • IP address and port (i.e. 127.0.0.1:47500, 9.9.9.9:47501, etc);
  • Hostname (i.e. host1.com, host2, etc);
  • Hostname and port (i.e. host1.com:47500, host2:47502, etc).
If port is 0 or not provided then default port will be used (depends on discovery SPI configuration).

Throws:
GridSpiException - If any error occurs.
Parameters:
addrs - Known nodes addresses.

getRegisteredAddresses

public Collection<InetSocketAddress> getRegisteredAddresses()
Gets all addresses registered in this finder.

Returns:
All known addresses, potentially empty, but never null.

registerAddresses

public void registerAddresses(Collection<InetSocketAddress> addrs)
Registers new addresses.

Implementation should accept duplicates quietly, but should not register address if it is already registered.

Parameters:
addrs - Addresses to register. Not null and not empty.

unregisterAddresses

public void unregisterAddresses(Collection<InetSocketAddress> addrs)
Unregisters provided addresses.

Implementation should accept addresses that are currently not registered quietly (just no-op).

Parameters:
addrs - Addresses to unregister. Not null and not empty.

public String toString()
